headline: Jacob Helberg, Trump's direct link to France's far right
description: Everyone in the French far right who wants to get close to Donald Trump knows that Jacob Helberg is the man to speak to. The French-American, a young under secretary of state for economic affairs, serves as a conduit for the reactionary, nationalist and anti-immigration vision that the president wants to impose on Europe.

headline: After the Epstein revelations, Jack Lang leaves a mixed record at the Arab World Institute
Lindsey Vonn's Olympic comeback ends in a violent crash
Trump shares racist video depicting the Obamas as monkeys, leaving White House scrambling
description: After initially denouncing what it described as 'fake outrage' from the media, the presidential administration eventually blamed the post on President Donald Trump's Truth Social account on an unidentified staffer's mistake and deleted it.

headline: Iran nuclear talks: Fragile resumption of discussions between Washington and Tehran
description: The US announces new sanctions targeting Iranian oil exports and continues to warn of the possibility of large-scale military intervention.

headline: Thailand's Orange Party, the frontrunner in Sunday's election, aims to outperform its 2023 results
description: The People's Party, the progressive 'Orange' party that succeeded the dissolved Move Forward in 2024, has softened its proposals on reforming the monarchy and the military, but for most Thais, it still embodies the camp of change.

headline: 'Dependence on the US is deeply rooted in the European mindset'
description: Europe continues to struggle to find its own voice on the international stage because it remains trapped in a cognitive dependence on Washington, writes Rosa Balfour, director of the Carnegie Europe think tank.

headline: Japan's PM Sanae Takaichi set to win big in snap legislative elections
Portugal votes in presidential run-off
Robert Crumb, comic book author: 'I am a paranoid person and I make fun of that'
French foreign trade undergoes a surprising rebound in spite of Trump's trade war
In Haiti, the transitional presidential council hands over power to PM Alix Dider Fils-Aimé
The Netherlands learns a lesson on right and far-right alliances
French companies cut down on drinking at work
Washington Post CEO Will Lewis exits after drastic job cuts: 'Right time for me to step aside'
Spain and Portugal brace for more floods
2026 Olympics Figure Skating: Russia ban opens up team event like never before
Bruno Retailleau, a hardline conservative ready to run for French president
The bride wore Birkenstocks
'Canada, better the 28th EU member than the 51st US state'
description: The Canadian prime minister has called for an alliance of middle powers to stand up to the world's great powers. This is a compelling idea, and one that Europe has been pursuing for 60 years, writes Le Monde columnist Pascal Riché.

headline: Bad Bunny, the anti-Trump icon made in Puerto Rico
description: On Sunday, in front of tens of millions of television viewers, the Puerto Rican reggaeton phenomenon will headline the Super Bowl halftime show, on the heels of winning Album of the Year at the Grammys. But, at a time when the ruthless crackdown on undocumented immigrants is raging in the US, inviting this Latin icon to one of America's major events was always bound to anger Donald Trump.

headline: Richard Reeves, the researcher studying the suffering of the modern man
description: Keen to combat the exploitation of male discontent by the far right, Reeves, who founded the American Institute for Boys and Men think tank, wrote a book that explains the appeal of this political current to men.

headline: Epstein scandal tarnishes former minister Jack Lang and France's image
The US versus human rights
'In the US, Christian nationalism contributes to the dismantling of democracy'
